page.title: 06IBSTOCK WATCH-MAKER
page.content: One long-standing business at{ {Ibstock}is that of the Page family, {watch-makers and jewellers.}Founded in 1914 by his father, it is presently run by Mr Ronald Page and his son Keith. Although many traditional methods are followed, the business has changed with the advent of the{micro-chip}and digital watches. There are electronic machines to regulate time-pieces and assist with fault-finding, whilst clock parts are now cleaned with ultra-sonic sound waves being passed through fluid. Some tasks, however, like wheel-making, are still carried out on an original machine made by the founder. The main income of the business is from repairs of time-pieces and jewellery. The selling of these items is secondary.
